channel.title: How to make small based operating systems like Rockbox?
channel.description:
I just got a new Zune for the holidays, and it's nice, but I really want to hack it. I look at the new mods out there like Rockbox and iPodLinux, and I would really like to make one for my Zune.
I know enough to downgrade the firmware so that I can activate external hard drive mode, and after that I can access the bios, and insert a program that starts up before the zune software. The only problem for me is, using the controls of the zune, and keeping components like the wifi and radio intact.
If anyone could give me any tips, it would be very appreciated, or if someone could direct me towards a site for development of something like rockbox, where I could gather more ideas.
Thanks for reading, Buzzy

item.title: How to make small based operating systems like Rockbox?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Yeah… too bad they still haven’t gotten wireless DRM free

Read full topic

item.title: How to make small based operating systems like Rockbox?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

Well, one there is the fact that people spend time looking for holes in the software, and the fact that with the earlier versions of firmware you could activate external hard drive mode, and I think we all know what that means.

Read full topic

oh okay, are there any other advantages for it?

item.title: How to make small based operating systems like Rockbox?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

One of the Zune Hack/Mod support sites has a board dedicated to the past versions of the firmware in hopes that we might be able to find holes in the software (as microsoft usually does this).

Read full topic

item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I too got a zune, 30gb white [130 or so from ToysRUs]. I know RockBox is being developed for it, meanwhile, how did you downgrade yours?

Read full topic
